M.G.L. c. 186.proposition: Under Massachusetts law, a landlord owes a tenant the covenant of quiet enjoyment (an implied covenant) which guarantees that the tenant will have the right to the possession and beneficial use of the leased premises without substantial interference from the landlord or conditions attributable to the landlord.

105 CMR 410.000 et seq. (Mass. State San.raw_text: 105 CMR 410.000 et seq. (Mass. State Sanitary Code — Minimum Standards of Fitness for Human Habitation)
105 CMR 410.000 et seq. (Mass. State San.proposition: The State Sanitary Code and public health statutes impose minimum standards for habitability and sanitary conditions and require landlords to maintain residential premises in a condition that is fit for human habitation.

M.G.L. c. 111 (public health statutes).proposition: The State Sanitary Code and public health statutes impose minimum standards for habitability and sanitary conditions and require landlords to maintain residential premises in a condition that is fit for human habitation.
